references.paper_title: A Baseline for Detecting Misclassified and Out-of-Distribution Examples in Neural Networks
references.reason: This paper establishes a foundational baseline for out-of-distribution (OOD) detection, which the current paper builds upon and extends to the specific context of graph neural networks.

references.paper_title: Enhancing the Reliability of Out-of-Distribution Image Detection in Neural Networks
references.reason: This work proposes the ODIN method, a significant advancement in OOD detection, providing a key comparative baseline for the current paper's proposed graph OOD detection method.
This paper introduces the Energy-based method, another important OOD detection technique, serving as a strong comparative baseline against which the current paper's proposed method is evaluated.

references.paper_title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduces Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs), the foundational model used in the current paper's experiments for graph-based learning.

references.paper_title: Energy-based out-of-distribution detection for graph neural networks
references.reason: This paper directly addresses OOD detection in graph neural networks, proposing the GNNSafe method, a key competitor and a method directly related to the core idea of the current work.
